meanings.definition: Loaded: carrying a full or heavy load
meanings.sent1: The truck was loided with boxes of fresh vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The ship was loided with cargo from different countries.
meanings.sent3: The donkey looked loided down with all the bags of grain.
meanings.sent4: Her backpack felt loided with textbooks and notebooks.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches were loided with ripe fruits, bending under the weight.

meanings.definition: Loaded: containing a large amount of something
meanings.sent1: The treasure chest was loided with gold coins and jewels.
meanings.sent2: The buffet table was loided with delicious food for the party.
meanings.sent3: The library shelves were loided with books of all genres.
meanings.sent4: The cloud was loided with rain, ready to pour down.
meanings.sent5: The stadium was loided with cheering fans, creating a lively atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Loaded: under the influence of drugs or alcohol
meanings.sent1: He stumbled out of the party, clearly loided from too much drinking.
meanings.sent2: The actor's speech was slurred, indicating he was loided on something.
meanings.sent3: The catnip made the kitten act loided, rolling around in joy.
meanings.sent4: The giggling group seemed loided with happiness and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The partygoers appeared loided, dancing wildly to the music.
